The patient underwent a routine liver biopsy yesterday and experienced two apneic periods. Post-procedure, the patient had a loss of consciousness (LOC), loss of pulse, and required cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) for less than 30 seconds. The initial rhythm was supraventricular tachycardia (SVT) at 160 beats per minute, then sinus rhythm, followed by stable VT, and then polymorphic VT. The patient was given 150 mg of amiodarone and 2 grams of magnesium, which converted the rhythm to sinus bradycardia. The patient was then transferred to the medical intensive care unit (MICU).
